intro: Pleuromanes, commonly known as false toadflax, are flowering plants belonging to the family Boraginaceae. They are characterized by their erect, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically blue or violet, arranged in clusters, and have five petals. These plants are native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. They are often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
